intro: Talisia laxiflora, commonly known as the woolly talisia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Talisia laxiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
